definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Throughout, she illustrates her analysis with excerpts from discussions.
sentences.chinese: 自始至终，她摘引讨论内容来阐明她的分析。

sentences.english: When she was young , she used to store quotations from poems in a notebook.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻时，常常在笔记本里记下一些摘引诗歌的内容。

sentences.english: The quotation of very long passages should be avoided .
sentences.chinese: 应该避免摘引非常长的段落。

sentences.english: He quoted profusely from Confucius and Mencius in his essays.
sentences.chinese: 他在文章中摘引孔孟的言论很多。

sentences.english: Language teachers often extract examples from dictionaries.
sentences.chinese: 语言教师常从词典中摘引例句。

definition: to quote/to cite/to recommend/to appoint/(computing) reference
to cite/to quote/to cite as evidence
marginal notes/annotation/to annotate/to add comments to text
author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
excerpt/selection (from a book)/to select/to choose an extract
preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]
